name: Internal Security Fund
title: Internal Security Fund
description: The Internal Security Fund (ISF, 2014-20) financed national and EU projects for policing, security and borders.
dataDescription: All data has been compiled via public sources or freedom of information requests to the relevant European Union or national institutions. Data may be incomplete or missing; some agencies or countries still haven’t responded to us, months later. Spreadsheets have been reformatted in order to fit into this data platform. If you see any errors, typos, translation issues or other problems, please get in touch:  hello@opensecuritydata.eu.
fileName: Open Security Data Europe - Internal Security Fund.ods

name: Horizon 2020
title: Horizon 2020
description: Horizon 2020 was the EU’s research and innovation budget from 2014 to 2020, with an overall budget of some €77 billion. The security research component had a total budget of €1.7 billion.
dataDescription: All data has been compiled via public sources or freedom of information requests to the relevant European Union or national institutions. name: FP7 Security
title: FP7 Security
description: The Seventh Framework Program for research and development (FP7) provided the first formal EU funding for security research, with €1.3 billion made available from 2007-13.
dataDescription: All data has been compiled via public sources or freedom of information requests to the relevant European Union or national institutions. name: EDIDP
title: European Defence Industrial Development Programme (EDIDP)
description: EDIDP, with a financial envelope of €500 million for 2019-2020, was the first ever EU grant programme targeting capability development and co-financing the joint development of (new and upgrading of existing) defence products and technologies. EDIDP was one of two precursor programmes of the European Defence Fund.

name: PADR
title: Preparatory Action on Defence Research (PADR)
description: The Preparatory Action on Defence Research (PADR) is a precursor programme of the European Defence Fund (EDF). PADR funds 18 research projects that have been selected following calls for proposals in the years 2017 to 2019, including an open call on disruptive technologies to test this new research field in view of the future EDF.
